original: FRIMAN, Carl Harry, Kapten, Stockholm, f Skövde 14/8 91 av kamrer P E F o Alma Muntzing, gm Märta Skog. Stud i Tyskl 10, 1 Engl 11, ex tekn sk Sthlm 12. Resoffex 15, fänr Vnorrl reg:s res 15, löjtn 18, kapt 30. Ing v A Karlson Metall- & Maskin AB Sthlm 12—16, ch f maskinavd där sed. 16. Styr.led i Falu Mek Verkst AB 17—23. Ordf Tekn frn M S Sthlm 30—32 o 34—36, led Sv Tekn.frn. K m:ts ombud i Sthlms Skyttefrb sed. 34. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Danm, Norge, Holl, Belg, Schweiz o Ital v öl tillf 10—39. Sthlms Skyt-tefrbs ftJM, Sthlms Lstfrbs ftJM, guldmärken i idrott, skidlöpn, Skytte, pistol (av militära), Arméns skytteM, RiksGM, Mästarmärke g. Hobbies: Arbetet, Skytte, idrott.
translated: FRIMAN, Carl Harry, Captain, Stockholm, born in Skövde on August 14, 1891, son of the accountant P.E.F. and Alma Muntzing, married to Märta Skog. Studied in Germany for 10 months, 1 month in England, and graduated from the technical school in Stockholm in 1912. Reserve officer examination in 1915, promoted to ensign in the northern regiment's reserve in 1915, lieutenant in 1918, captain in 1930. Worked for A. Karlson Metall- & Machine AB in Stockholm from 1912 to 1916, and then became head of the machine department there. Board member of Falu Mek Verkst AB from 1917 to 1923. Chairman of the Technical Association from M.S. in Stockholm from 1930 to 1932 and 1934 to 1936, member of the Swedish Technical Association. Appointed delegate for Stockholm Shooting Association since 1934. Travelled to Germany, England, Denmark, Norway, Holland, Belgium, Switzerland, and Italy on several occasions from 1910 to 1939. Finished first in Stockholm Shooting Association and Stockholm County Shooting Association competitions, received gold medals in sports, skiing, shooting, and military pistol competitions, Army Shooting Medal, National Shooting Gold Medal, Master's Badge. Hobbies: Work, Shooting, Sports.

structured.name: Carl Harry Friman
awards: First place in Stockholm Shooting Association competitions
First place in Stockholm County Shooting Association competitions
Gold medal in military pistol competitions
